Today, Dan and Jordan take a little breaky to the past.  In this installment, Alex creates a Michael Savage based conspiracy and performs a mini one-man show.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/4/7/episode-667-july-25-2003 Episode #667: July 25, 2003]</ref>:

*Former LA mayor Richard Riordan [https://www.sfgate.com/politics/article/RECALL-FEVER-Both-Huffingtons-Audie-Bock-2600228.php said he would not run] in the recall race if Arnold were to announce his candidacy
*Alex is convinced that Michael Savage is a globalist agent who is going to run in the CA recall race to take votes away from conservatives
*Alex has not heard that a nominee for the position of Secretary of the Navy [https://www.nytimes.com/2003/07/26/us/nominee-for-navy-secretary-killed-himself-official-rules.html has died by suicide]
*The band Poker Face has [https://web.archive.org/web/20030730172349/http://www.pokerface.com/ some great member bios]
*Alex is a little off about [https://www.trade.gov/country-commercial-guides/liberia-oil-and-gas Liberia's natural resources]
*Based on [https://www.nytimes.com/2003/07/26/world/president-orders-troop-deployment-to-liberian-coast.html US] and [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jul/03/julianborger UK] stories, it appears that Alex is wrong about troop numbers in Liberia as well
